column4: when i run rm Music/*/*/.* it gives me a bunch of rm: cannot remove `.' or `..'   errors. The command is supposed to remove any hidden file (.*) in any artist directory (first *) in any album directory (*) in my Music folder, is there a better way to do this?
I'd suggest find, but I am illiterate with it ;)  I've used gnome-find, a very old app for that
metacity --replace should work
thanks, I keep on forgetting that
useless for me, fglrx and all that grief
you'd edit /etc/network/interfaces ; if you know your ip address, netmask, broadcast address and gateway,  man interfaces will show you how to set it up
using something like vim?
exactly
ok, thanks. I assumed there was some file like that to edit.
here's a interfaces stanza I use at work: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/36009/
erm, do I need two dns nameservers?
no, it's just a fallback if the first goes down
will those dns servers work for me too, or should I use my own?
you should use the ones your isp provides
or some open ones :)
q_a_z_steve what are the advantages to using something like openDNS? I just need something that works so that I can still install stuff on my server.
your isp will have it's nameservers somewhere on it's web pages, it's good form to use them
might as well use the ones the rest of the comps in my house are using...
seems wise
Jordan_U q_a_z_steve thanks for your help.
you'd edit /etc/motd
thank you.
whats this I hear about ipod sync?
